Package br.ufrn.imd.Controller

Class TelaPrincipalComumController

java.lang.Object
br.ufrn.imd.Controller.TelaPrincipalComumController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class TelaPrincipalComumController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
TelaPrincipalComumController class that handles the actions and elements from the Common user main screen
Author:
Caio Vitor

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Method that is called when the screen is loaded and does the setting of the images in the elements of the screen. Also starts the listview of musics, and loads the musics saved in the songs.txt file using loadSongs method.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • handleListUserButton

      private void handleListUserButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method that handles the List Users button, changing the screen using changeScreen method
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • handleSignOutButton

      private void handleSignOutButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method that handles the Sign-Out button, changing the screen using changeScreen method and also saves the songs and stops the music if it's playing.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • muteButtonClicked

      public void muteButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method that handles the Mute button, alternating from muted to unmute using a flag and setting the correct image for each occasion.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • removeMusicClicked

      public void removeMusicClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method that handles the Remove Music button, removing the selected music in the List from the songs array, decreasing the index of musics lists and saving the changes with saveSongs method. Also, checks if the list is empty and playing, if so, stops the music.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • clearMusicsClicked

      public void clearMusicsClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Method that handles the Clear musics button, clearing all the musics stored in songs and saving the changes using saveSongs method. Checks it's playing and if the list is empty, if so, stops the music.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • playButtonClicked

      private void playButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that handles the Play button. First, checks if it's playing is true, if so, pauses the music, set a new image for the button and resets the progress bar. Else, it gets the selected index from the list and uses to get the music with that index from the songs array, checking if the file ends with ".mp3" extension. If so, plays the musics, starts the progress bar, set the volume to max and changes the button image.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • nextButtonClicked

      private void nextButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that handles the next button click. First, checks if the next index is in the correct range of the array (songs). Then, checks if the progress bar is running, if so, resets it. Then add +1 to the music Index, stops the last playing music, starts the next one, changes the play button image and starts the progress bar.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • previousButtonClicked

      private void previousButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that handles the previous button click. First, checks if the previous index is in the correct range of the array (songs). Then, checks if the progress bar is running, if so, resets it. Then remove -1 to the music Index, stops the last playing music, starts the next one, changes the play button image and starts the progress bar.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • selectDirectoryButtonClicked

      private void selectDirectoryButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method to handle the select directory button click. The method operates equals, but has 3 condition checks. If the mediaPlayer is null, that means that no music has been played before. If the mediaPlayer is different from null and the music is playing. And If the mediaPlayer is different from null and the music isn't playing. For these three occurrences, it works the same way, its created and directory chooser object, it will check if the directory is different from null and will persist the data from that selected directory and will call for the updateMusicList and saveSongs methods. There's only a tiny detail, if enters the condition that the music is playing, it will pause the music and reset the progress bar.
      Parameters:
      event -

    • updateMusicList

      private void updateMusicList(File[] files)
      Method to update the music list. First, clears the names in the displayed list, then it will only add the files that end up with ".mp3" extension to the songs array and at ending will insert the names of the songs in the displayed list on the screen, if the songs array isn't empty.
      Parameters:
      files -

    • startProgressBarTimer

      private void startProgressBarTimer()
      Method to start the progress bar, using the duration and the current time of the music to make the progression space of the bar.

    • resetProgressBar

      private void resetProgressBar()
      Method to reset the progress bar

    • saveSongs

      private void saveSongs()
      Method to save the songs stored in the songs array in a ".txt" file, printing a success message and making use of exception treatment, since it's working with files.

    • loadSongs

      private void loadSongs()
      Method to load the songs from the ".txt" file to the songs array when the program is started. It will check if the ".txt" file exists, if it doesn't, will create it and return. If exists, but it's empty, will print a warning message and return. If it's all good, it'll load the musics from the songs.txt to the songs array.

    • updateMusicListFromLoading

      private void updateMusicListFromLoading()
      Private method to update the music list displayed on the screen using the songs loaded from the songs.txt file
